title: Pacific coast
text:
Pacific coast may be used to reference any <a href="coastline">coastline</a> that borders the <a href="Pacific%20Ocean">Pacific Ocean</a>.
Geography.
Americas.
Countries on the western side of the <a href="Americas">Americas</a> have a Pacific coast as their western or southwestern border, except for <a href="Panama">Panama</a>, where the Pacific coast is primarily on its southern border. The first Europeans to see the Pacific Ocean were able to do so by crossing the narrow Panama <a href="isthmus">isthmus</a>. The unique position of Panama in relation to the Pacific Ocean resulted in the ocean initially being named the South Sea.
Asia.
Countries on the <a href="East%20Asia">eastern</a> and <a href="Maritime%20Southeast%20Asia">southeastern</a> sides of <a href="Asia">Asia</a> have a Pacific coast as part (or all) of their border.
Australia and Oceania.
Australia's Pacific coast is on its eastern border. Countries in <a href="Oceania">Oceania</a> may have a Pacific coast anywhere, including their entire border.
